intro: Hermione crispicorona, commonly known as the crinkled crown, is a rare and striking member of the Gesneriaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves with a distinctive crinkled texture and waxy surface. Its flowers are typically orange or red, with five lobes and a spurred shape, adding to its ornamental appeal. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is often cultivated in greenhouses or specialized gardens.
